title: This Modern House in Portugal Comes with Two Guesthouses
text:
Listing of the Day

Location: Algarve, Portugal

Price: €4.95 million (US$6.16 million)

Although it was built in 2008, this Portuguese villa possesses the charm of a much older property. Its clean and classic main house is flanked on either side by bright pink structures. On one side is a more traditional Portuguese dwelling, which the home’s agent, Kerstin Buechner, describes as "a very Algarvian country house style."

It was restored and "authentically renovated" as a guesthouse when the main house was built. On the other side of the main house is a Moroccan-themed enclosed courtyard, its bright facade inspired by the cheerful guesthouse.

The two houses are detached and enjoy separate gardens, kitchens and dining areas, while subtle and tasteful Moroccan touches unify the interior atmosphere of the two dwellings.

More: Portugal’s Tech Startups Have Revved Up Lisbon’s Real Estate

Stats

This 10,118-square-foot home has five bedrooms and six bathrooms between its two structures. The main house has three bedrooms and four bathrooms, while the guesthouse has two bedrooms and two bathrooms. The property sits on 1.4 acres of land.

Amenities

The most stunning feature of this home is its 18-meter infinity pool that extends from its beautifully landscaped Algarvian gardens up to a covered patio. The gardens are complete with automatic irrigation, while the home has air conditioning, both essentials in the Portuguese heat.

In addition to a steam room and gym, the home boasts a soundproof cinema/music room with a small wine cellar and a novelty candy kiosk, both of which are located right outside the cinema door.

More: ‘Golden Visa’ Driving Lisbon’s Luxury Real Estate Boom

Neighborhood Notes

The rural hilltop area of Palmeiral where the villa is located might better be known, according to Ms. Buechner, as "the hills beside Loule," which she describes as "a little like Tuscany, with lots of cypress trees and winding little roads." The area benefits from gorgeous views down the coast.

Loule is a small and charming market town just five minutes from the property. The bustling town has fresh meat and vegetables for sale every day and a lovely family atmosphere, growing 10 times its size on Saturdays, according to Ms. Buechner. It’s also home to many music festivals throughout the year that see an influx of thousands of people, such as a jazz festival and a Mediterranean festival.

Palmeiral, only a 10-minute drive from the more traditionally sought-after golf resorts and beaches of the Algarve, offers buyers a more authentic Portuguese atmosphere.

Ms. Buechner added that the houses being built in this area have a spec as good as any house Savills has in their books anywhere, while being more affordable than the golf resort prices which, having risen consistently over the past 20 years, are now "too expensive for most mortals."

Agent: Kerstin Buechner, a director at QP Savills
